title: Textile, 18th century
medium:
Medium: cotton
Technique: mordant painted and resist dyed on plain weave (chintz)
provenance: Formerly in the Jacques Martin collection in Paris (this determination made because of an incomplete label on the back which appears to be in Jacques Martin's hand and because 1973-51-43 was formerly in the collection of Jacques Martin.
dimensions:
Warp x Weft (a): 81.5 x 89.2 cm (32 1/16 x 35 1/8 in.)
Warp x Weft (b): 81 x 56.6 cm (31 7/8 x 22 5/16 in.)
description: Two pieces which were originally part of a larger panel. Both are made of two separate cloths. A border of fantastic undersea life on a purple background and a field of birds and flowers emanating from a vermicular tree.

tombstone.epitaph:
Textile, 18th century.
18th century. Medium: cotton
Technique: mordant painted and resist dyed on plain weave (chintz). Bequest of Elinor Merrell. 1995-50-320-a,b.
